extendedIngredients.name: chili
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Dorot chopped chili cube (1 teaspoon finely chopped red chili pepper)

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 Dorot garlic cubes (1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic, about 3 cloves)

extendedIngredients.name: ginger
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 Dorot crushed ginger cubes (1 tablespoon finely minced fresh ginger)

extendedIngredients.name: mixed vegetables
extendedIngredients.originalString: 16 ounces frozen stir fry vegetables, thawed (or any fresh or frozen vegetables you have on hand—I used Trader Joe's Harvest Hodgepodge)
metaInformation: or any  vegetables you have on hand—i used trader joe's harvest hodgepodge)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus extra for coating pasta

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (or more to taste)

extendedIngredients.name: roasted peanuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup chopped unsalted roasted peanuts, plus additional for serving

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed into bite-sized pieces (1 to 1 1/4 pounds)

extendedIngredients.name: vegetable stock
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup low-sodium vegetable stock or water

recipes.title: Hot and Sour Noodle Stir Fry with Peanut Chicken
recipes.instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook pasta until just tender. Drain and toss with a little olive oil to prevet sticking. Set aside.In a large nonstick skillet or wok, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken, 2/3 of the ginger, 2/3 of the garlic, and salt. Saute until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes. Remove to a plate and set aside.To the skillet, add the stir fry vegetables, cabbage, remaining 1/3 ginger and 1/3 garlic, and sauté until the vegetables are hot and the cabbage is slightly tender, about 8 minutes. Add the stock, soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar. Cook 2 minutes. Add the reserved pasta, reserved chicken, peanuts and pepper flakes to pan. Toss gently to combine, then serve warm, topped with additional roasted peanuts as desired.

steps.step: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook pasta until just tender.
Drain and toss with a little olive oil to prevet sticking. Set aside.In a large nonstick skillet or wok, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken, 2/3 of the ginger, 2/3 of the garlic, and salt.
Saute until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes.

Remove to a plate and set aside.To the skillet, add the stir fry vegetables, cabbage, remaining 1/3 ginger and 1/3 garlic, and sauté until the vegetables are hot and the cabbage is slightly tender, about 8 minutes.
Add the stock, soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar. Cook 2 minutes.
Add the reserved pasta, reserved chicken, peanuts and pepper flakes to pan. Toss gently to combine, then serve warm, topped with additional roasted peanuts as desired.
